paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant Ala97Ser, its clinical significance, and penetrance data in patients with familial amyloid polyneuropathy.

patients.phenotype: familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) with disabling neuropathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: There were 28 patients (25 men) with Ala97Ser transthyretin and late onset (59.9 ± 6.0 years) disabling neuropathy.

functional_data.summary: The study documented the pathological evidence of sudomotor denervation in FAP.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the studied cohort.
variants.additional_notes: All patients had clinical and electrophysiological evidence of polyneuropathy.
key_quotes: Patients with orthostatic hypotension or absent sympathetic skin response at palms were associated with lower SGIIPGP 9.5.
During the follow-up (3.8 ± 1.6 years after skin biopsies), all patients had a progressive course leading to disability.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a specific TTR variant.
